title: Freelance Full Stack Web Developer
role: I developed an interactive online exhibition, 'For Good or ill', for Many Studios by building a custom microsite within the Squarespace platform using HTML, CSS, and jQuery to create an engaging and interactive user experience.
Worked closely with program manager and technical lead, following an agile process with weekly sprints, async standups, and sprint demos.

My role included building the microsite, optimizing images while preserving the visual quality of the artworks, cross-browser testing, and debugging,and ensuring smooth deployment and performance within the Squarespace environment.

title: Technical Mentor (Volunteer role)
role: I use the skills I learned as a trainee at CYF to give back to the community.
I also utilise my organisational skills from my public health career by helping organise delivery of classes and supporting as a teaching assistant to deliver the CYF Full Stack curriculum.
I also provide support to trainees through 1-to-1 mentorship and giving constructive feedback.
Alongside that, I work as part of a small developer team consisting of trainees and mentors on internal CYF projects.

title: Full Stack Developer
role: Worked with a team of three developers in an Agile setting to build a learning evaluation tool for CYF to help students test their knowledge on training modules.
I was involved from the beginning of the project, from developing the concept through to implementing features using brainstorming, planning, daily standups, and retrospectives.
I worked across the entire application, building user interfaces using React (React Hooks), backend APIs with Express.js and working on the mongoDB database.
Throughout the project, we collaborated closely through pair programming and frequent discussions.

title: Trainee Full Stack Developer
role: I worked on both the frontend and backend of the project taking responsibility for building new features and fixing bugs.

I participated in Scrum ceremonies from sprint planning, daily standups and retrospectives. I used project management tools like Trello to track my progress throughout each sprint, opened PRs and implemented any code review comments while remaining active and communicative on slack.

The app was built in an Agile environment following the Model View Controller(MVC) design pattern using different technologies, tools and processes such as React, Node, PostgreSQL, Bootstrap, Git, GitHub, VSCode and Heroku.
